name: Tokyo Skytree
description: Tokyo Skytree is a broadcasting and observation tower. It is known for being the second tallest structure in the world (after the Burj Khalifa in the United Arab Emirates). It is 634m high and was built with earthquake resistance.

name: CN Tower
description: The CN Tower is a 553m-high communications and observation tower located in Toronto, Ontario. For 32 years, the CN Tower held the title of being the tallest freestanding structure in the world. The tower was named one of the Seven Wonders of the Modern World by the American Society of Civil Engineers in 1994.

name: Eiffel Tower
description: As a global icon, the Eiffel Tower in Paris is the most-visited paid monument in the world. The structure is a wrought-iron lattice that stands 324m tall. For 41 years, the tower held the title of being the tallest man-made structure in the world.

name: Leaning Tower of Pisa
description: The Leaning Tower of Pisa is a bell tower for the city of Pisa's cathedral. Due to an unstable foundation, the structure leans by almost 4 degrees. The tower is approximately 56m high and is made of marble and stone. Its construction was completed in 1372.

name: Space Needle
description: Constructed in 1962, the Space Needle is an iconic observation tower located in Seattle, Washington. The 184m-high structure is seismically resistant and has 25 lightning rods that help protect the structure from lightning strikes.

name: Canton Tower
description: The 604m-high Canton Tower is located in the city of Guangzhou (historically known as Canton). It was the tallest tower in the world for 2 years (2009-2011), and is now the second tallest. The structure was built for the 2010 Asian Games and is currently used for observation and telecommunications.

name: Oriental Pearl Tower
description: The Oriental Pearl Tower is a radio and television tower located in Shanghai. Completed in 1994, it stands at a height of 468m and uniquely features 11 spheres of varying sizes, linked by three columns.

name: Ostankino Tower
description: The Ostankino Tower is a concrete radio and television tower in Moscow. It stands tall at 540m and was the tallest free-standing structure in the world for 7 years (between 1967 and 1974).

name: Macau Tower
description: The 338m-high Macau Tower is used for tourism, observation, telecommunications, and broadcasting. Recently, the tower has been used for adventurous activities such as bungee jumping. It was constructed in 2001 and features great views of Macau.

name: Kuala Lumpur Tower
description: Also known as the Menara Kuala Lumpur, the 421m-high Kuala Lumpur Tower is the 7th tallest freestanding tower in the world. It features an Islamic Lunar observatory and is generally open to the public. Annual races allow athletes to race up the stairs to the top.

name: Al Hamra Tower
description: The Al Hamra Tower in Kuwait City was built in 2011 and is the tallest carved concrete skyscraper in the world. The structure measures 414m in height. Its flared walls and column-free, 24m-high lobby are unique features of the tower.

name: Empire State Building
description: The 102-storey Empire State Building in New York City was the world's tallest building for almost 40 years (until the late 1970s). It is named for New York state's nickname, 'Empire State'. The structure's design was changed 15 times to make sure that it would be the world's tallest building. Approximately 4 million people visit the building's observatories annually.

name: Spinnaker Tower
description: Also known as the Emirates Spinnaker Tower, this landmark was opened in 2005 in the city of Portsmouth. It is a 170m-high observation tower located in the city's harbour area. The tower's design was inspired by a spinnaker, which is a type of sail that arcs outward in the wind.

name: Tokyo Tower
description: Tokyo Tower is a 333m-tall observation and communications tower. It is painted every 4 years in white and international orange to meet air safety regulations; painting the tower takes one year! The tower's construction was completed in 1958 and still stands prominent in Tokyo's skyline.

name: Petronas Towers
description: Also called the Petronas Twin Towers, these skyscrapers were the tallest buildings in the world for 6 years (until 2004). The structures are 452m tall, have 88 floors, and are constructed mostly of concrete. The glass and steel facade was designed to mimic Islamic art themes.

name: Taipei 101
description: Taipei 101 was the world's tallest building for 6 years (from 2004 to 2010). It is certified Platinum by the Leadership in Energy and Environmental Design (LEED) certification program, which recognizes its exceptional environmental responsibility and efficient use of resources. The building is known for the 101 fireworks displays on New Year's Eve.

name: Calgary Tower
description: The 191m-high Calgary Tower was conceived as part of Canada's centennial celebrations in 1967. It is an observation tower and popular tourist attraction in downtown Calgary. The tower's column was built in a continual pour of concrete that took place over 24 days, which is a notable accomplishment of workmanship.

name: N Seoul Tower
description: More commonly known as the Namsan Tower or Seoul Tower, the 236m-high N Seoul Tower is a communication and observation tower located on Namsan Mountain in Seoul. The tower was constructed in 1971 and opened to the public 9 years later; it has now become one of the city's notable landmarks.

name: Shanghai World Financial Center
description: The Shanghai World Financial Center is a mixed-use skyscraper housing shopping malls, offices, hotels, museums, and observation decks. Its construction was completed in 2008, has 101 storeys, and stands tall at 492m.

name: Washington Monument
description: The Washington Monument, located in Washington, D.C., is an obelisk that was constructed to honor George Washington (the first president of the United States). The 169m-high structure is made of stone (including marble, granite, and bluestone gneiss). The Egyptian-style structure was the world's tallest structure from 1884 to 1889.

name: Stratosphere Tower
description: Located on Las Vegas Boulevard in Nevada, the Stratosphere Tower is the tallest freestanding observation tower in the United States. The $70 million tower was opened in 1996. It features two observation decks and several amusement park attractions at the top.

name: Sydney Tower
description: Located in Sydney's central business district, the 309m-high tower functions as an observation tower that is open to the public. Built in 1981, it has now become one of Sydney's most prominent attractions.

name: Burj Khalifa
description: Since 2009, the Burj Khalifa has held the record for being the tallest structure and building in the world, standing at 828m high--that's almost one kilometer! The tower was conceived to help Dubai gain international recognition, and its design was inspired by Islamic architecture in the area. The primarily concrete structure took 5 years to construct.

name: Olympic Stadium
description: Located in Montreal, the Olympic Stadium was built in the 1970s for the 1976 Summer Olympics. It is nicknamed 'The Big O' after the doughnut shape of the stadium's roof as well as its huge construction cost ($1.47 billion). The stadium can accommodate concerts and baseball, soccer, and football games. At the north base of the stadium is the 175m-high Montreal Tower, the world's tallest inclined tower.

name: Kuwait Towers
description: The Kuwait Towers, built in 1979, consist of three water towers in a larger system of 34 towers. It stands by the Persian Gulf and has now become a prominent landmark of modern Kuwait. The tallest of the three towers is 187m high; its lower sphere holds water and as well as a restaurant and reception hall; its upper sphere holds a revolving cafe.

name: Cologne Cathedral
description: Also known as the Cathedral Church of Saint Peter, the Cologne Cathedral is Germany's most-visited landmark (over 20,000 people a day). Being 157m tall, it is the world's tallest twin-spired church. Construction began in 1248 and was halted for centuries until it was finally completed in 1880.

name: Blackpool Tower
description: Blackpool Tower, located on the Lancashire coast in northwest England, is 158m tall tower built in 1894. 5 million bricks, 3,500 tons of steel, and 360 tons of cast iron were used in its construction. The top of the tower features a flagpole, while underneath the foundation stone of the tower lies a time capsule!

name: Sky Tower
description: The Sky Tower, located in Auckland, is an observation and telecommunications tower that stands 328m tall. It is the tallest freestanding structure in the Southern Hemisphere and, with three observation towers, it attracts almost half a million visitors annually. The tower features a SkyJump attraction that allows jumpers to reach up to 85 km/hr speeds!

name: One World Trade Center
description: Also known as the Freedom Tower, the One World Trade Center is the main building of the reconstructed World Trade Center complex in New York City (following the terrorist attacks of September 11, 2001). It is the tallest building in the United States, and the seventh tallest building in the world.

name: Bank of China Tower
description: The Bank of China Tower stands prominent in Hong Kong's skyline, at 367m high. Its triangular patterned glass facade is distinct. Opened in 1990, it was the first skyscraper outside of the United States to break the 305m (1,000ft) height mark.

name: Marina Bay Sands Hotel Towers
description: The three 194m-high hotel towers at the Marina Bay Sands Hotel are topped by a 340m-long SkyPark, the world's largest public cantilevered platform. The hotel was opened in 2010 as part of a large resort and casino complex. The design of the towers was inspired by a deck of cards.

name: Makkah Royal Clock Tower
description: The Makkah Royal Clock Tower, located in the city of Mecca, is the central tower in a complex of seven skyscraper hotels. It has the world's largest clock face and, with a height of 601m, it is the fifth tallest freestanding structure in the world.

name: Lotte World Tower
description: The Lotte World Tower is a 555m-high skyscraper in Seoul that was opened to the public in 2017. The building holds offices, a hotel, residential spaces, and retail spaces. The design of the building was changed more than five times.

name: The Shard
description: Also known as the Shard of Glass and the Shard London Bridge, The Shard is a 310m-high tower designed by an Italian architect and built in 2012. It was designed to be a slender, spire-like building emerging from the River Thames.

name: Chrysler Building
description: The 319m-high Chrysler Building is the tallest brick building in the world with a steel framework. An icon of New York City, it was the world's tallest building for 11 months until the record was broken by the Empire State Building, located in the very same city, in 1931.

name: Lakhta Center
description: Located in Saint Petersburg, Lakhta Center is the tallest building in Europe. It is 462m tall and is meant to become the new headquarters of a Russian energy company when it opens in 2020. About 3,000 people are employed to construct the structure!

name: Landmark 81
description: Landmark 81 is a 461m-high skyscraper located in Ho Chi Minh City. It is located in a mixed-use urban area surrounded by other high rises. The structure's construction finished in 2018 and its Skyview observation deck has opened in 2019.

name: Shanghai Tower
description: Shanghai Tower, which is 632m high, is the second-tallest building in the world. Along with the Ping An Financial Center, it has the world's highest observation deck (at 562m high). The structure has 106 elevators! It was completed in 2014 and publicly opened in 2016.

name: 30 St Mary Axe
description: Nicknamed The Gherkin, 30 St Mary Axe is a 180m-high skyscraper in the city of London. It was completed in 2013 and functions as a 41-storey office building. It has a neo-futuristic architectural style, which came about in the late 20th to early 21st centuries.

name: Ryugyong Hotel
description: The 330m-high Ryugyong Hotel, located in Pyongyang, is the tallest unoccupied building in the world. The pyramid-shaped structure is nicknamed the 105 Building, referencing its number of floors. Although the building's exterior was completed in 2011 and an LED display was fitted to the side of the building in 2018, the building has yet to be completed to this day--its future remains a mystery.
